notes_display: Obv./rev. overstruck or double struck; rev.die cracks
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right Profile of Shapur II on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with three floral elements; covered korymbos; two ribbons commencing to the left below the lorymbos, pointing upwards, pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing above ball of hair, pointing upwards, earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double row of pearls running the shoulders to the breast ornament (the latter not visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 1 h l. i. mzdysn bgy šhpwhly MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n MNW ctry yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Šābuhr šāhān šāh Ēran kē čihr az yazdān| "the Mazda-worshiping, divine Shapur, King of Kings of the Iranians, whose image| brilliance is from the gods"; symbol in front  of bust (SNS 3, var. 32)
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; on the shaft l'st (rāst,“ just”), to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, three altar plates; above bust with diadem and elaborate coiffure to the right, surrounded by flames depicted by vertical lines; to the left and right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Shapur II, holding a barsom with both hands, both figures facing inwards; dotted border
